subject: [HW 03] Q5: Towers of Hanoi
content:
Q5: Towers of Hanoi

Please post all questions you have below concerning Q5: Towers of Hanoi in the follow-ups.

If you are stuck on this question, feel free to read through the follow-up responses to see if you can draw any ideas from them.

threads.question: If a function doesn't **return** itself but instead just **calls** itself(i.e. in cool_function(), it simply "cool_function()" instead of "return cool_function"), is it still considered a recursive function? I had this whim, but I believe it is still recursive because in algorithms like merge sort, it also calls, instead of return, itself. I just wanna figure it out semantics- wise.

follow-ups.feedback: Yes, it is recursive. From the textbook section 1.7: "A function is called _recursive_ **if the body of the function calls the function itself** , either directly or indirectly." It's not a requirement to precede this call with a return statement.
Yeah, this very clause is where I based my assumption upon as I remember reading it. Thanks!
